page.title: 01AREA OVERVIEW
page.content: The square which we were allocated covers the Billinge, Garswood and Downall Green area. The outstanding feature of the area is the beacon which is situated on top of Bilinge Hill. In the past the land was used for mining but now there are only two mines left in the area, both of which are privately owned. In some places opencast mining made the arable land only suitable for dairy farming. The land is now mainly used for farming, cereal crops are the main crop, with some potatoes. Billinge is an old settlement with several old buildings made of stone from the old quarry, but the modern houses are made from brick. It is reputed that some of the old houses are haunted. People have moved from urban areas to swell the population.
